flawed_nl_solution:
She uses 4 hours/day * 125 watts/hour=<<4*125=500>>500 watt hours/day
That means she uses 500 watt hours/day * 7 days/week = <<500*7=35000>>35000 watt hours/week
This is 35000 watt hours / 1000 watts/kw = <<35000/1000=35>>35 kw hours
So her TV cost 35 kw hours/week * $0.14/kw hour = $<<35*0.14=4.9>>4.9/week
#### 490.00000000000006

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3500, not 35000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
